result.execSummary:
The defendant Laracuene Rudy Campos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Probation conditions to apply, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision  and DNA fees during period of probation. Failrue to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

Must provide a DNA sample for the State Crime lab if not previously done so 973.046 and 973.047.
Defendant cannot vote in any election until your civil rights are restored 973.176(2).  
As a a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possesion of any firearm 941.29 Wis. stats make it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it's own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000.00 fine or both.  Possess weaopns as convicted felon 973.176(1).
No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
Report date is 7/22/2014 by 3:00 p.m.
The first 21 days will be served in custody without release privileges.
After this Initial perios of incarceration  if you have no major rules violations, and are accepted into the Day Reporting Program, you may serve the balance of yor sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program.  The Court has no objection to the defendant being placed on electronic monitoring while participating in the program.  Should the defendant violate either conditions of electronic monitoring or the rules of the Day Reporting Program the defendant will  serve the balance of said sentence without release privileges.
*Possession or use of any illegal controlled substances or alcohol forfeits the huber, work release privilegs and any referral of reporting time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laracuene Rudy Campos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order as to Count 1 signed and filed.  Copies mailed to defendant and the State./ds
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. jbs
Order denying request for electronic monitor signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15 (LF), for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on GPS.

Statements made as to sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.
COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, with credit for 1 day time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the Sentence and placed the Defendant on Probation for a period of 3 years with the following conditions as to PROBATION / EXTENDED SUPERVISION ARE AS FOLLOWS:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE sobriety.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. 
*  MUST provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab, if you have not previously done so.  973.046 and 973.047
*  Defendant cannot vote in any election until your civil rights are restored.  973.176(2)
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms 941.29 Wis. Stats. make it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both. Possess Weapon as Convicted Felon 973.176(1)

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  Defendant is sentenced to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction. The first 21 days will be served in custody without release privileges. After this initial period of incarceration, if you have no major rules violations, and are accepted into the Day Reporting Program, you may serve the balance of your sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program. The Court has no objection to the Defendant being placed on Electronic Monitoring while participating in the program. Should the Defendant violate either conditions of Electronic Monitoring or the rules at the Day Reporting Program the Defendant will serve the balance of said sentence without release privileges.

Possession or use of any illegal controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the Huber (work release) privileges and any referral of reporting time.

REPORT DATE:  Defendant is to report for serving time on 07-22-2014 by 03:00 pm.

Received and filed with court:
*  Sentencing Referral Form
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  DNA Collection Form
Defendant Laracuene Rudy Campos in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Laracuene Rudy Campos in court with attorney James E Toran.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Fred Svensson, interpreter, sworn-in.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
